overview: "“EAST OAKLAND COUNTER NARRATIVES”, (80 minutes) is a place-based homage to Black families that have been rooted in East Oakland since 1950s. This new film is a compilation of videotaped oral histories. Eighteen interviewees revealed memories and experiences that African American families endured post WWII in Deep East Oakland. EAST OAKLAND COUNTER NARRATIVES, includes voices from distinct generations who highlight their lives in ways that differ from what outsiders assume. Cheryl Fabio, the filmmaker, intentionally selected statements that woven together become a collective tribute to home. Storytellers include Angela Scott, Antoinette Broussard Farmer, Candice Elder, Carla Cravanas Alexander, Carolyn “CJ”Johnson, Dan-iel Drakes, Daphne Muse, DJ D Sharp, Earnest Jenkins III, Esther Goolsby, Pastor G. Annette Howard, Howard Oliver, Imam YahYa Ibn Shabaz, John Jones III, Marquita “Keta” Price, Nedra T. Williams, Regina Jackson, Ronald Eric Fabio II, and Zarina Ahmad."
title: East Oakland Counter Narratives
